name: Pavan Gururaj Shiraguppi
title: Gen AI Engineer | Data Scientist | systems Engineer
summary: Generative AI Engineer SME with a unique trajectory spanning Systems Integration, Data Science, and LLM Engineering. Proven track record of building production-grade AI solutions contributing to $10M+ in revenue. Specialized in LLM fine-tuning, RAG architectures, and multi-robot system integration (RoboCafe). Expert in designing experiments, validating models, and deploying AI at scale. Bilingual in English and Japanese (N2).

highlights: Subject Matter Expert (SME) for the IBM watsonx platform, leading secure on-premise deployments of watsonx.ai and watsonx Orchestrate to architect scalable, compliant generative AI infrastructure for enterprise environments.
Spearheaded high-impact Generative AI engagements contributing to over $10M in revenue, designing and optimizing enterprise LLM solutions for digital transformation.
Fine-tuned and optimized custom Large Language Models (LLMs) including Llama, Granite, and GPT variants to maximize domain-specific accuracy and reduce token latency by 40%.
Architected advanced RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) systems integrating vector databases (ChromaDB, Pinecone) for context-aware AI applications.
Built intelligent AI agents using IBM Watsonx Orchestrate and LangChain, enabling autonomous task execution and complex multi-step reasoning.
Advised enterprise clients on Generative AI adoption strategies, identifying high-ROI use cases for LLM integration.
Conducted feasibility studies for RAG architectures, guiding technical teams on model selection (OpenAI vs Open Source) and infrastructure requirements.
Established governance frameworks for LLM evaluation, defining metrics for hallucination rates and response accuracy.
Designed and devised GPT-driven recommendation algorithms, applying collaborative filtering techniques to improve semantic relevance.
Conducted advanced NLP modeling for sentiment analysis and entity extraction, leveraging BERT transformers to achieve high-precision text classification.
Researched and validated RAG methodologies, experimenting with vector embeddings to solve context-window limitations.
Performed rigorous A/B testing on model inference parameters, statistically validating improvements in response quality.
Architected the 'RoboCafe' bio-system, orchestrating interoperability between industrial arms (Kawasaki, Yaskawa, Mitsubishi) and service robots (Pudu Robotics, AGVs).
Designed the precise integration protocols between stationary industrial robots and mobile service robots, enabling seamless physical handoffs and synchronized path planning.
Integrated Computer Vision models with robot arm kinematics to enable autonomous object manipulation in a dynamic café environment.
Bridged the gap between hardware interfaces (PLCs, Robot Controllers) and software AI modules, creating a seamless end-to-end automated solution.
